reviewText:
This game was reviewed using a code sent by the developer.
Hit Tank PRO is a challenge mode based action strategy game, releasing on December 2nd 2015, by a single developer Bacq Stellan.

Gameplay in Hit Tank PRO is set in a birds eye view of a small simple map, where you are in control of a single tank, and you have to destroy varying numbers of enemy tanks. Each of the maps are set out differently, some come with mazes, some have destructible objects,  whilst others have a fog of war mechanic, leaving you in the lurch as to what you can see.  Whilst the gameplay is very simple, it comes with a very addictive nature to it, and the higher levels can get really fast paced and hectic as the levels progressively get harder and more enemies that you have to deal with. I would really liked to have seen some sort of levelling process for your tank, or some sort of customizability, maybe to upgrade weapons or your armour, but the only sort of customizing you get, is changing the speed of your tank at the start of the game. You can obviously make your tank the fastest, but this will in turn give your score a handicap compared to if you didnâ€™t make your tank faster. There are 60 levels in this game too, so quite a stack of levels to go at.

Graphics are very basic, the top down view helps it a little here, but honestly the graphics are nothing to shout about. I was a little let down by the sprites of the tanks and the overall aesthetic of the game, it would have been nice to get some better looking maps to fight in. The sound effects are OK, however the music is weirdâ€¦it sounds a bit like Wild West music, but in tanks? I donâ€™t quite know how to explain it, something just didnâ€™t sound right about the music in Hit Tank PRO.

There are a varying amount of difficulties here, there are four difficulty settings, Easy, Normal, Medium (arenâ€™t they the same?) and hard.  Onto of these difficulty settings, you can also make the game harder or easier by changing the bullet speed, your hitbox size, and of course, your tankâ€™s speed. This adds another layer of difficulty settings, allowing you to tweak how hard (or easy) the game is for you.

I have been playing on Normal difficulty for about half an hour now, and I have managed to clear all sixty levels, that to me show that whilst there are a lot of levels, there isnâ€™t anything really challenging unless you ramp up the difficulty settings to a higher level. You could probably get three or four hours of more content out of the game with varying levels of difficulty, but thatâ€™s about it.

I sadly had a few annoying technical issues, one is that the game doesnâ€™t use any direct x engine, so I was unable to capture any footage using Fraps. Secondly (and the most annoying) is the game doesnâ€™t lock your cursor in its window, this is only really an issue for anyone with more than one screen â€“ youâ€™ll often find your cursor has wandered across to your other screens, youâ€™ll click and the game minimizes, this is an infuriating bug which almost always results in you dying. The third and probably the biggest big, is a game breaking one unfortunately. Some levels youâ€™ll end up clearing all of the tanks you can see, and the game will insist that there is one tank left alive, when there quite clearly isnâ€™t. This is even more prominent on the levels past stage 50. You canâ€™t even kill yourself by shooting a rocket into yourself, the game just breaks, you actually have to quit the game in order for it to work again, and obviously this loses your scores.

To sum up, I really like the premise behind the gameplay of this game, but sadly in its current state it isnâ€™t going to be recommended. I am not going to lie; I did actually have fun in the game, when it worked. I think the game can improve a lot on the graphical front, and include some customizability in to make completing the levels feel more like an accomplishment. I personally think that this game would really benefit from a local or online multiplayer mode as I can see that being a ton of fun too. Most of all, the bugs and glitches need to be cleaned up ASAP.  The game is priced at Â£1, 99 when not on sale, and there is also a demo to try out too if you are still interested in trying it out.

Tom's Score Card
1) Stay away
2) Not Recommended
3) Only recommended when on sale
4) Recommended
5) Highly recommended
6) This is a must play

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up. You can also find more reviews over at http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/

Please also check out Completing the Backlog's Curator page here - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

reviewText:
Basic Information
Title: Hit Tank PRO
Genre: Action, Casual, Indie, Strategy
Developer: Bacq Stellan
Publisher: Bacq Stellan
Release Date: 2 Dec, 2015

General Impression
This game is a perfect combination of the war, strategy and indie genres. The controls are very easy to use, making it even more enjoyable. For its price, I am recommending it to anyone who is up for a challenge. There is a total of 60 levels, which keep getting harder and harder, you can also set the difficulty (4 in number) which will choose how many lives you will have at your disposal.

Strong PointsPretty decent graphics
Decent sounds
Challenging gameplay
Very diversified maps
Three mode challenges
Many difficulties to choose from
Many obstacles around the maps
Many skins for enemy tanks
Weak PointsNo other enemies than tanks
Not enough instructions
Only one soundtrack
After level 30-40 the game gets very hard
It would have been even nicer with multiplayer
General Ratings
Graphics: 7.5/10
Atmosphere: 8/10
Audio: 7/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Story: N/A
Engines: 8.5/10

Personal Rating: 7.8/10

reviewText:
Hit Tank PRO reminds of an old game, whose name I can't remember, where you're a tank pitched against others. You have the same core mechanics here. And thanks to Bechstein, I found the name: Battle City.

You're directing a tank through different levels and your goal is to destroy every enemy present. Some of them are stationary and slow to fire, while others are moving and sending many rockets towards you. You get hit? You're trying the level again with all enemies spawning again. Depending on the difficulty, you will have less lives to do.

8 minutes is short to write a review. However, when you've played some levels, you know already how the game will be. The graphics are correct and the soundtrack is just a jingle and tanks sounds.

The game is itself a nice little one when you want to take a little break. However, my main problem is the menu in the Missions mode. Indeed, while it's great to have included the three different types of moving (arrows, WASD and ZQSD), while it's great to choose for each level your difficulty, some options, your speed or the hit box, the problem is that when you're pointing your cursor on the keys options, speed or hitbox, you can change the options you have set. And when you're think that ZQSD is chosen and that in reality, you have the arrows.... I mean, it would be great that at least, the choice of ZQSD, WASD or arrows is on another menu and not on the one where you're setting your preferences for the level. Also, when you finish a level, instead of advancing to the next one, you're sent back to the menu (which is normal if you want to change the difficulty or anything else) and if you don't click yourself on Next"

reviewText: A simple, yet surprisingly entertaining game. While it is in no way revolutionary and some of the game's features such as level progression and the screen resolution could definitely use some update, 'Hit Tank' is the perfect game for those of you who have a limited amount of free time as the game doesn't require it's players to devote hours and hours on end into it for you to succeed.

reviewText:
Top down tank shooter with easy to use controls .
Instructions aren't 100% (i think the game dev is a non English speaker) but you can figure it out quite quickly just by playing.
Perfect little game if you want some casual fun for a short time .
But be warned ,the difficultly increases the more you progress.
Though It's satisfying to get one up on the incoming enemies :)
Easily worth the asking price i thought as the game is well made for what it is.
I did notice one problem (i think ),i was playing with the arrow keys and on the next mission the keys went to wasd.
Hope that small issue can be fixed in an update.

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QqbZndwRJKo

This game is far from special, unique or anything to make you go woah! I am only slightly leaning towards the recommend due to price and the fact of the game is not broken and plays well.

I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a very simple time killer, 'miniclip' flashbacks and general dorking around.

I would not recommend this to people who are achievement hunters (because no achievements), Extreme tank enthusiasts looking for some great tank challenges and people who are expecting too much from a very simple game.

My attached preview video will give you a better idea of the game and if it's your cup of tea.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Simple and entertaining game of action and strategy where basically you move tanks and open fire to survive. The best thing is that the game has a variety of maps and the difficulty which you can choose to taste without stalling a long time in it. As you progress more interesting it is and depending on how you move some obstacles can play against or in favor. Very useful to use the walls to bounce your shots and thus evade enemy fire if you want to not be very exposed because the enemy anticipates your moves.

The best of the shots is that you can spam infinite missiles. If you win well but if you lose experience a feeling of revenge or something like that, it creates addiction. The controls can be changed if you want. No experienced errors or glitches that prevented play, all very fluid and simple. I really enjoyed the game even to play it sporadically any time. If you like simple games of move and shoot would you recommend this.

reviewText:
Simple and fun shooter.

Theres are very interesting mechanic which is unlike other games; the missles that you shoot bounces which reminds me of a billiard/pool table game.

There's some strategy and hand coordination (gotta go fast to dodge enemy missles) involved for such a simple game.

reviewText: Hit Tank Pro is a hard one to review, because if you put aside the fact that it feels unfinished, the art isn't the most beautiful and the controls aren't perfect, if you can get past that you can actually have some fun with this game. It feels a lot like the old NES title 'Battle City', I haven't seen anything else like this in the store, so if you like that one and are looking for something similar you might enjoy this one too, if not I'm not sure if I'd recommend this to you.

reviewText:
Hit Tank Pro is an amazing game which combines the shooting, strategy, and war genres in one.

Pros:

* Awesome game concept that is fun to play

* 60 unique levels with ascending diffculty

* 9 Different Enemies ,each with its own fighting style, powers, and weaknesses

* Cool retro-style graphics

* 3 Game Modes to play with

* 4 Levels of Difficulty to tailor the game to your own playstyle.

Cons:

* The background music can get a bit dull after a while ( But you can always play your own! )

Conclusion: This game is well-worth its price and guarantees you many hours of pure fun. Anyone even slightly interesting in this game should absolutely give it a try!

reviewText: It's exactly like one of those bad flash games we used to play as children. The missions are boring and when you finish a mission it brings you to the main menu and you have to manually move to the the next mission and to make it even worse you can beat each mission in roughly 10-20 seconds even on the hardest difficulty. In fact all the hard difficulty does is limit you to one type of weapon and 1 life and I don't need more than that anyways because the missions are very easy. It has no achievements or anything to keep you going. The description is also actually a lie. In the Steam Store. It says: Hit Tank PRO is an addictive game of fast action that combines Strategy
date: Action and Challenge." But it actually quite the opposite it's not addictive at all
recommended: it got boring real fast and it doesn't require strategy at all and there is no action at all and neither any challenge as I mentioned above. I wouldn't spend one cent in this game."
